observation: Seaham Town Council - Home  Home Latest News Press Releases Seaham Newsletters Our Environmental Initiatives The Council The Mayor Find Your Council Representatives Your Councilliors Meetings Responsibilities & Services Strategic Documents Local Government Transparency Council Policies Councillor Information Packs Annual Accounts Privacy Policy Information Places of Interest Seaham Town Hall Gallery Historic Seaham Twin Town Gerlingen Useful Links Non-Emergency Services Schools Sports Clubs Health Provision Transport Links More ... Events Contact Us In the Cold Short Days of January Help Celebrate Everything Positive About Seaham 17 January 2024 News Read More Dog Bag Distribution in Seaham 17 November 2023 Seaham Town Council Environmental Sustainability 21 July 2021 All Stars Cricket 16 April 2024 Seaham Wins Best Coastal Resort 22 September 2023 Reclaiming our Seas 10 October 2022 Destination Seaham Group Read our Latest Newsletter 11 March 2024 Fundraise and Recycle Bin Council Offers Free Litterpicking Equipment Welcome to the Seaham Town Council Website Seaham Town Council’s website which is designed to provide information about the town and the many amenities which make it an excellent place to live and work. With an expanding population of circa 21,500, Seaham is located in the north east of England with stunning cliff top views over the harbour. It is a coastal town in County Durham (the land of the Prince Bishops), 12 miles east of Durham City and 6 miles south of Sunderland. Seaham’s popular North beach, with its sea washed sand and rock pools has been greatly enhanced by a fine, long sea wall which also protects the crumbling cliffs and Coast Road. There are numerous view points on the cliff tops and picnic areas at Seaham Hall, St. Mary the Virgin Church, Noses Point and the Port of Seaham. Within the town there is ample free car parking.
